intro: Mentzelia incisa, commonly known as the narrowleaf mentzelia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble daisies. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, often in rocky soils, and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Its leaves are narrow and linear, and it produces small, yellowish to reddish flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Mentzelia incisa is also known for its medicinal properties and has been used by indigenous peoples for various purposes.
